alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 02 at 3:29AM PDT until November 03 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches above 5000 feet and 2 to 4 inches on the highest peaks. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...San Diego County Mountains above 5000 feet. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 8 AM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will lower to 5500 to 6000 feet today and 4000 to 4500 feet for late tonight into Thursday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
